types.name: Date
types.description: A date string, such as 2007-12-03, compliant with the `full-date` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: A date-time string at UTC, such as 2007-12-03T10:15:30Z, compliant with the `date-time` format outlined in section 5.6 of the RFC 3339 profile of the ISO 8601 standard for representation of dates and times using the Gregorian calendar.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: ObjectID
types.description: A field whose value conforms with the standard mongodb object ID as described here: https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/ObjectId/#ObjectId. Example: 5e5677d71bdc2ae76344968c

fields.name: appLaunchURL
fields.description:
A URL to be passed to the associated app when launching it.

The app receives this URL in the [application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uiapplicationdelegate/1622921-application): and [application:openURL:options:](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uiapplicationdelegate/1623112-application) methods of its app delegate.

If this key is present, the `associatedStoreIdentifiers` key must also be present.

fields.name: associatedStoreIdentifiers
fields.description:
A list of iTunes Store item identifiers for the associated apps.

Only one item in the list is used—the first item identifier for an app compatible with the current device. If the app is not installed, the link opens the App Store and shows the app. If the app is already installed, the link launches the app.

fields.name: authenticationToken
fields.description: The authentication token to use with the web service. The token must be 16 characters or longer.

fields.name: backgroundColor
fields.description: Background color of the pass, specified as an CSS-style RGB triple. For example, rgb(23, 187, 82).

fields.name: barcode
fields.description: Information specific to the pass’s barcode.
fields.deprecationReason: Deprecated in iOS 9.0 and later; use `barcodes` instead.

fields.name: barcodes
fields.description:
Information specific to the pass’s barcode. The system uses the first valid barcode dictionary in the array. Additional dictionaries can be added as fallbacks.

Available only in iOS 9.0 and later.

fields.name: beacons
fields.description:
Beacons marking locations where the pass is relevant.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: boardingPass
fields.description: Information specific to a boarding pass.

fields.name: coupon
fields.description: Information specific to a coupon.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Brief description of the pass, used by the iOS accessibility technologies.

Don’t try to include all of the data on the pass in its description, just include enough detail to distinguish passes of the same type

fields.name: eventTicket
fields.description: Information specific to an event ticket.

fields.name: expirationDate
fields.description:
Date and time when the pass expires.

The value must be a complete date with hours and minutes, and may optionally include seconds.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: foregroundColor
fields.description: Foreground color of the pass, specified as a CSS-style RGB triple. For example, rgb(100, 10, 110).

fields.name: formatVersion
fields.description: Version of the file format. The value must be 1.

fields.name: generic
fields.description: Information specific to a generic pass.

fields.name: groupingIdentifier
fields.description:
Optional for event tickets and boarding passes; otherwise not allowed. Identifier used to group related passes. If a grouping identifier is specified, passes with the same style, pass type identifier, and grouping identifier are displayed as a group. Otherwise, passes are grouped automatically.

Use this to group passes that are tightly related, such as the boarding passes for different connections of the same trip.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: labelColor
fields.description:
Color of the label text, specified as a CSS-style RGB triple. For example, rgb(255, 255, 255).

If omitted, the label color is determined automatically.

fields.name: locations
fields.description: Locations where the pass is relevant. For example, the location of your store.

fields.name: logoText
fields.description: Text displayed next to the logo on the pass.

fields.name: maxDistance
fields.description:
Maximum distance in meters from a relevant latitude and longitude that the pass is relevant. This number is compared to the pass’s default distance and the smaller value is used.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: nfc
fields.description:
Information used for Value Added Service Protocol transactions.

Available in iOS 9.0.

fields.name: organizationName
fields.description: Display name of the organization that originated and signed the pass.

fields.name: passTypeIdentifier
fields.description: Pass type identifier, as issued by Apple. The value must correspond with your signing certificate.

fields.name: relevantDate
fields.description:
Recommended for event tickets and boarding passes; otherwise optional. Date and time when the pass becomes relevant. For example, the start time of a movie.

The value must be a complete date with hours and minutes, and may optionally include seconds.

fields.name: serialNumber
fields.description: Serial number that uniquely identifies the pass. No two passes with the same pass type identifier may have the same serial number.

fields.name: storeCard
fields.description: Information specific to a store card.

fields.name: suppressStripShine
fields.description:
If `true`, the strip image is displayed without a shine effect. The default value prior to iOS 7.0 is `false`.

In iOS 7.0, a shine effect is never applied, and this key is deprecated.

fields.name: teamIdentifier
fields.description: Team identifier of the organization that originated and signed the pass, as issued by Apple.

fields.name: userInfo
fields.description:
Custom information for companion apps. This data is not displayed to the user.

For example, a pass for a cafe could include information about the user’s favorite drink and sandwich in a machine-readable form for the companion app to read, making it easy to place an order for “the usual” from the app.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: voided
fields.description:
Indicates that the pass is void—for example, a one time use coupon that has been redeemed. The default value is false.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: webServiceURL
fields.description:
The URL of a web service that conforms to the API described in [PassKit Web Service Reference](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/PassKit/Reference/PassKit_WebService/WebService.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40011988).

The web service must use the HTTPS protocol; the leading https:// is included in the value of this key.

On devices configured for development, there is UI in Settings to allow HTTP web services.

fields.name: altText
fields.description: Text displayed near the barcode. For example, a human-readable version of the barcode data in case the barcode doesn’t scan.

fields.name: format
fields.description: Barcode format.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Message or payload to be displayed as a barcode.

fields.name: messageEncoding
fields.description: Text encoding that is used to convert the message from the string representation to a data representation to render the barcode. The value is typically iso-8859-1, but you may use another encoding that is supported by your barcode scanning infrastructure.

fields.name: major
fields.description: Major identifier of a Bluetooth Low Energy location beacon.

fields.name: minor
fields.description: Minor identifier of a Bluetooth Low Energy location beacon.

fields.name: proximityUUID
fields.description: Unique identifier of a Bluetooth Low Energy location beacon.

fields.name: relevantText
fields.description: Text displayed on the lock screen when the pass is currently relevant. For example, a description of the nearby location such as “Store nearby on 1st and Main.”

fields.name: attributedValue
fields.description: Attributed value of the field. The value may contain HTML markup for links. Only the `` tag and its `href` attribute are supported. For example, the following is key-value pair specifies a link with the text “Edit my profile”: `"attributedValue": "Edit my profile"` This key’s value overrides the text specified by the value key. Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: changeMessage
fields.description:
Format string for the alert text that is displayed when the pass is updated. The format string must contain the escape %@, which is replaced with the field’s new value. For example, “Gate changed to %@.”

If you don’t specify a change message, the user isn’t notified when the field changes.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: ISO 4217 currency code for the field’s value.

fields.name: dataDetectorTypes
fields.description:
Data detectors that are applied to the field’s value.

The default value is all data detectors. Provide an empty array to use no data detectors.

Data detectors are applied only to back fields.

fields.name: dateStyle
fields.description: Style of date to display.

fields.name: ignoresTimeZone
fields.description:
Always display the time and date in the given time zone, not in the user’s current time zone. The default value is `false`.

The format for a date and time always requires a time zone, even if it will be ignored. For backward compatibility with iOS 6, provide an appropriate time zone, so that the information is displayed meaningfully even without ignoring time zones.

This key does not affect how relevance is calculated.

Available in iOS 7.0.

fields.name: isRelative
fields.description:
If `true`, the label’s value is displayed as a relative date; otherwise, it is displayed as an absolute date. The default value is `false`.

This key does not affect how relevance is calculated.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The key must be unique within the scope of the entire pass. For example, “departure-gate.”

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label text for the field.

fields.name: numberStyle
fields.description: Style of number to display. Number styles have the same meaning as the Cocoa number formatter styles with corresponding names.

fields.name: textAlignment
fields.description:
Alignment for the field’s contents.

The default value is natural alignment, which aligns the text appropriately based on its script direction.

This key is not allowed for primary fields or back fields.

fields.name: timeStyle
fields.description: Style of time to display.

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value of the field, for example, `42`.

fields.name: altitude
fields.description: Altitude, in meters, of the location.

fields.name: latitude
fields.description: Latitude, in degrees, of the location.

fields.name: longitude
fields.description: Longitude, in degrees, of the location.

fields.name: relevantText
fields.description: Text displayed on the lock screen when the pass is currently relevant. For example, a description of the nearby location such as “Store nearby on 1st and Main.”

fields.name: encryptionPublicKey
fields.description: The public encryption key used by the Value Added Services protocol. Use a Base64 encoded X.509 `SubjectPublicKeyInfo` structure containing a ECDH public key for group P256.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The payload to be transmitted to the Apple Pay terminal. Must be 64 bytes or less. Messages longer than 64 bytes are truncated by the system.

fields.name: auxiliaryFields
fields.description: Additional fields to be displayed on the front of the pass.

fields.name: backFields
fields.description: Fields to be on the back of the pass.

fields.name: headerFields
fields.description:
Fields to be displayed in the header on the front of the pass.

Use header fields sparingly; unlike all other fields, they remain visible when a stack of passes are displayed.

fields.name: primaryFields
fields.description: Fields to be displayed prominently on the front of the pass.

fields.name: secondaryFields
fields.description: Fields to be displayed on the front of the pass.

fields.name: transitType
fields.description: Required for boarding passes; otherwise not allowed. Type of transit.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Project ID

fields.name: name
fields.description: Project name

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Task ID

fields.name: id
fields.description: User ID

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.
